dsx1XCurrentTable.name: dsx1XCurrentTable
dsx1XCurrentTable.description: A list of current statistics entries. This table contains additional objects for the current table.

dsx1XCurrentEntry.name: dsx1XCurrentEntry
dsx1XCurrentEntry.description: An entry containing additional statistical counters applicable to a particular current table.

dsx1CurrentLOS.name: dsx1CurrentLOS
dsx1CurrentLOS.description: The counter associated with the number of LOS seconds, encountered by a DS1 interface in the current 15 minute interval.

dsx1CurrentLOF.name: dsx1CurrentLOF
dsx1CurrentLOF.description: The counter associated with the number of LOF seconds, encountered by a DS1 interface in the current 15 minute interval.

dsx1CurrentLOC.name: dsx1CurrentLOC
dsx1CurrentLOC.description: Loss Of Cell delineation. Counts number of cells the ATM UNI cells receiver lost cells delineation .

dsx1CurrentAIS.name: dsx1CurrentAIS
dsx1CurrentAIS.description: The counter associated with the number of AIS seconds, encountered by a DS1 interface in the current 15 minute interval.

dsx1CurrentRAI.name: dsx1CurrentRAI
dsx1CurrentRAI.description: Remote Alarm Indication: Transmitted in the outgoing direction (toward the PABX) over FDL bits when the DS1 device detected an incoming Loss Of Frame. Received from the far end (PABX) over FDL when it detects a Loss of frame.

dsx1CurrentLOMF.name: dsx1CurrentLOMF
dsx1CurrentLOMF.description: Loss of Multi-Frame sequence in E1 time slot 16.

dsx1CurrentFEBE.name: dsx1CurrentFEBE
dsx1CurrentFEBE.description: Far End Block Errors, as reported in the first bit of frames 13 and 15, on multiframe E1 lines with CRC4, in the current 15 minute interval.

dsx1CurrentStatus.name: dsx1CurrentStatus
dsx1CurrentStatus.description: The statuses of the current interval: 0 - Valid. 1 - redundantLinkSwitch - the link has been switched by a redundancy mechanism. 2 - discontinuity - module was partialy out. 4 - notValid - module is out.

dsx1CurrentBPV.name: dsx1CurrentBPV
dsx1CurrentBPV.description: The counter associated with the number of BPVs (Bi-Polar Violations) encountered by a DS1 interface in the current 15 minute interval.

dsx1CurrentLOCRCMF.name: dsx1CurrentLOCRCMF
dsx1CurrentLOCRCMF.description: Loss of CRC4 Multi-Frame sequence in E1. encountered in the current 15 minute interval

dsx1CurrentLOFC.name: dsx1CurrentLOFC
dsx1CurrentLOFC.description: Counts the number of loss of frame events measured. encountered in the current 15 minute interval

dsx1CurrentCRCErrors.name: dsx1CurrentCRCErrors
dsx1CurrentCRCErrors.description: Counts the number of CRC error events, encountered in the current 15 minute interval.

dsx1XIntervalTable.name: dsx1XIntervalTable
dsx1XIntervalTable.description: A list of Interval entries. This table contains additional objects for the interval table.

dsx1XIntervalEntry.name: dsx1XIntervalEntry
dsx1XIntervalEntry.description: An entry containing additional statistical counters applicable to a particular interval table.

dsx1IntervalLOS.name: dsx1IntervalLOS
dsx1IntervalLOS.description: The counter associated with the number of LOS seconds , encountered by a DS1 interface in one of the previous 96, individual 15 minute, intervals.

dsx1IntervalLOF.name: dsx1IntervalLOF
dsx1IntervalLOF.description: The counter associated with the number of OOF seconds, encountered by a DS1 interface in one of the previous 96, individual 15 minute, intervals.

dsx1IntervalLOC.name: dsx1IntervalLOC
dsx1IntervalLOC.description: Loss Of Cell delineation. Counts number of cells the ATM UNI cells receiver lost cells delineation .

dsx1IntervalAIS.name: dsx1IntervalAIS
dsx1IntervalAIS.description: The counter associated with the number of AIS seconds, encountered by a SONET interface in one of the previous 96, individual 15 minute, intervals.

dsx1IntervalRAI.name: dsx1IntervalRAI
dsx1IntervalRAI.description: Remote Alarm Indication: Transmitted in the outgoing direction (toward the PABX) over FDL bits when the DS1 device detected an incoming Loss Of Frame. Received from the far end (PABX) over FDL when it detects a Loss of frame.

dsx1IntervalLOMF.name: dsx1IntervalLOMF
dsx1IntervalLOMF.description: Loss of Multi-Frame sequence in E1 time slot 16.

dsx1IntervalFEBE.name: dsx1IntervalFEBE
dsx1IntervalFEBE.description: Far End Block Errors, as reported in the first bit of frames 13 and 15, on multiframe E1 lines with CRC4, in one of the previous 96, individual, 15 minute intervals.

dsx1IntervalStatus.name: dsx1IntervalStatus
dsx1IntervalStatus.description: The statuses of the current interval: 0 - Valid. 1 - redundantLinkSwitch - the link has been switched by a redundancy mechanism. 2 - discontinuity - module was partialy out. 4 - notValid - module is out.

dsx1IntervalBPV.name: dsx1IntervalBPV
dsx1IntervalBPV.description: The counter associated with the number of BPV (Bi-Polar Violations) encountered by a DS1 interface in one of the previous 96, individual 15 minute, intervals.

dsx1IntervalLOCRCMF.name: dsx1IntervalLOCRCMF
dsx1IntervalLOCRCMF.description: Loss of CRC4 Multi-Frame sequence in E1.

dsx1IntervalLOFC.name: dsx1IntervalLOFC
dsx1IntervalLOFC.description: Counts the number of loss of frame events measured in one of the previous 96, individual 15 minute, intervals.

dsx1XTotalTable.name: dsx1XTotalTable
dsx1XTotalTable.description: A list of Total statistics entries. This table contains additional objects for the Total table.

dsx1XTotalEntry.name: dsx1XTotalEntry
dsx1XTotalEntry.description: An entry containing additional statistical counters applicable to a particular current table.

dsx1TotalLOS.name: dsx1TotalLOS
dsx1TotalLOS.description: The counter associated with the number of LOS (Loss of Signal) seconds encountered by a DS1 interface in the previous 24 hour interval. Invalid 15 minute intervals count as 0.

dsx1TotalBPV.name: dsx1TotalBPV
dsx1TotalBPV.description: The counter associated with the number of BPV (Bi-Polar Violations) encountered by a DS1 interface in the previous 24 hour interval. Invalid 15 minute intervals count as 0.

dsx1TotalLOFC.name: dsx1TotalLOFC
dsx1TotalLOFC.description: The counter associated with the number loss of frames encountered by a DS1 interface in the previous 24 hour interval. Invalid 15 minute intervals count as 0.

dsx1DataStreamStatTable.name: dsx1DataStreamStatTable
dsx1DataStreamStatTable.description: The DS1 Data Stream Statistics table.

dsx1DataStreamStatEntry.name: dsx1DataStreamStatEntry
dsx1DataStreamStatEntry.description: An entry in the DS1 Data Stream Statistics table.

dsx1DataStreamStatIfIndex.name: dsx1DataStreamStatIfIndex
dsx1DataStreamStatIfIndex.description: The index of the DS1 interface. It may be ifIndex.

dsx1DataStreamStatIndex.name: dsx1DataStreamStatIndex
dsx1DataStreamStatIndex.description: The DS1 Data Stream Index. For Vmux - the following indices are used: 1 for Transparent 2-3 for SS71-SS72 (respectively) 4-7 for Data1-Data4 (respectively) .

dsx1DataStreamStatValid.name: dsx1DataStreamStatValid
dsx1DataStreamStatValid.description: Indicates whether this Data Stream is valid or not. When invalid - all counters are irrelevant.

dsx1DataStreamStatInFrames.name: dsx1DataStreamStatInFrames
dsx1DataStreamStatInFrames.description: The counter associated with the number of received frames, encountered by the DS1 Data Stream.

dsx1DataStreamStatInBytes.name: dsx1DataStreamStatInBytes
dsx1DataStreamStatInBytes.description: The counter associated with the number of received bytes, encountered by the DS1 Data Stream.

dsx1DataStreamStatInDiscards.name: dsx1DataStreamStatInDiscards
dsx1DataStreamStatInDiscards.description: The counter associated with the number of Discarded incoming frames, encountered by the DS1 Data Stream.

dsx1DataStreamStatInErrors.name: dsx1DataStreamStatInErrors
dsx1DataStreamStatInErrors.description: The counter associated with the number of received Errored frames, encountered by the DS1 Data Stream.

dsx1DataStreamStatOutFrames.name: dsx1DataStreamStatOutFrames
dsx1DataStreamStatOutFrames.description: The counter associated with the number of transmitted frames, encountered by the DS1 Data Stream.

dsx1DataStreamStatOutBytes.name: dsx1DataStreamStatOutBytes
dsx1DataStreamStatOutBytes.description: The counter associated with the number of transmitted bytes, encountered by the DS1 Data Stream.

dsx1DataStreamStatOutDiscards.name: dsx1DataStreamStatOutDiscards
dsx1DataStreamStatOutDiscards.description: The counter associated with the number of Discarded outgoing frames, encountered by the DS1 Data Stream.

dsx1XConfigTable.name: dsx1XConfigTable
dsx1XConfigTable.description: An extension to the DS1 Configuration table.

dsx1XConfigEntry.name: dsx1XConfigEntry
dsx1XConfigEntry.description: An entry containing additional configuration parameters.

dsx1IdleCode.name: dsx1IdleCode
dsx1IdleCode.description: Byte pattern of the data received/transmitted in the E1T1 framer idle timeslots. Valid range: (0 - FF HEX).

dsx1LineMode.name: dsx1LineMode
dsx1LineMode.description: T1 device operation mode. Valid for T1 only.

dsx1dBTxGain.name: dsx1dBTxGain
dsx1dBTxGain.description: Transmit line Gain for T1 CSU line mode.

dsx1RxSensitivity.name: dsx1RxSensitivity
dsx1RxSensitivity.description: Determine the maximum attenuation of the receive signal that can be compensated for by the interface receive path. Not applicable for T1.

dsx1RestoreTime.name: dsx1RestoreTime
dsx1RestoreTime.description: Used to change the sync. algorithms to reduce the time required for the port to return to normal operation after a RED alarm. 'sec1' = Fast, 'sec10' = TR-6211, 'immediate' = CCITT

dsx1TcFirstSignal.name: dsx1TcFirstSignal
dsx1TcFirstSignal.description: Trunk conditioning signal - value to be sent as a signal during the first 2.5 seconds after alarm detection. Range is 0x0..0xF. 0xFF is a NULL value. This variable is used also for Space Signaling Code (in this case 0xFF is not NULL).

dsx1TcSignal.name: dsx1TcSignal
dsx1TcSignal.description: Trunk conditioning signal value after alarm detection. Range is 0x1..0xF for E1, and 0x0..0xF for T1. This variable is used also for Space Signaling Code (E1 and T1).

dsx1TcPattern.name: dsx1TcPattern
dsx1TcPattern.description: Trunk conditioning data pattern to be sent upon a DS0 fail. Range is 0x0..0xFF. This variable used also for Out of Service Code.

dsx1Scramble.name: dsx1Scramble
dsx1Scramble.description: Scrambling is an operation that randomizes the bits of the payload of the ATM cell by a polynom. This operation helps with the error detection mechanism of the HEC. Not applicable for E1. active - will scramble/descramble the payload ATM cell notActive - will not scramble/descramble.

dsx1LineAdaptiveTimingMode.name: dsx1LineAdaptiveTimingMode
dsx1LineAdaptiveTimingMode.description: Enables end to end clock synchronization. Default value - off.

dsx1TxClockSource.name: dsx1TxClockSource
dsx1TxClockSource.description: The source of Transmit Clock. 'loopTiming' indicates that the recovered receive clock is used as the transmit clock. 'localTiming' indicates that a local clock source is used or when an external clock is attached to the box containing the interface. 'throughTiming' indicates that recovered receive clock from another interface is used as the transmit clock. 'adaptive' indicates that the clock is recovered according to the received data flow rate.

dsx1AisEnable.name: dsx1AisEnable
dsx1AisEnable.description: Enable/ disable AIS transmit when Ethernet cable (for TDMoIP) is out (disconnected).

dsx1TsEchoCancel.name: dsx1TsEchoCancel
dsx1TsEchoCancel.description: This parameter defines for each TS whether Echo-Cancellation is on. Each bit represents one TS as follow: First octet bit'0' = TS#1, bit'7' = TS#8, .. 2nd octet bit'0' = TS#9,.., 4th octet bit'7' = TS#32. Octets and bits order is from left to right: [31,30,..24] [23..16] [15..8] [7..0] MSB LSB MSB LSB MSB LSB MSB LSB For each bit values are: 0 - Echo-Cancellation off. 1 - Echo-Cancellation on.

dsx1EchoCancelerModule.name: dsx1EchoCancelerModule
dsx1EchoCancelerModule.description: This parameter indicates whether echo-cancellation module exists for this line.

dsx1PortFunction.name: dsx1PortFunction
dsx1PortFunction.description: This object determines the ATM Mode over the physical port. uni - The port will function as an ATM UNI. ces - The port will function as a CES. ima - The port will function as an IMA-ATM.

dsx1PortMultiplier.name: dsx1PortMultiplier
dsx1PortMultiplier.description: This object determines the data rate of each TS (Kbps units). This parameter is applicable for T1 only.

dsx1LeasedLine.name: dsx1LeasedLine
dsx1LeasedLine.description: This parameter defines whether Line mode is regular (non Leased Line mode) or transparent (Leased Line mode).

dsx1CsuLoop.name: dsx1CsuLoop
dsx1CsuLoop.description: This parameter defines whether CSU loop will be done locally (by IPmux) or will be transferred to the TDM device.

dsx1ClockSource.name: dsx1ClockSource
dsx1ClockSource.description: This entry specifies the source from which the clock will be taken. Refer to device specification for source Index

dsx1OosSignal.name: dsx1OosSignal
dsx1OosSignal.description: This parameter defines the value to be sent as a signal after alarm detection: 'Space' = both A and B signaling bits are forced to '0' during out-of-service periods. 'Mark' = both A and B signaling bits are forced to '1' during out-of-service periods. 'spaceMark' = A and B bits are forced to '0' for 2.5 seconds; then they are switched to '1' until out-of-service condition disappears. 'markSpace' = A and B bits are forced to '1' for 2.5 seconds; then they are switched to '0' until out-of-service condition disappears. - '0'= 0 for T1, 1 for E1, or user defined value for Space - '1'= 1 for T1, 0 for E1, or user defined value for Mark.

ds1LocalMultiframeAlarmTrap.name: ds1LocalMultiframeAlarmTrap
ds1LocalMultiframeAlarmTrap.description: This trap indicates near end (Local) Loss of Multiframe Alignment, of the user E1 interface.

ds1RemoteMultiframeAlarmTrap.name: ds1RemoteMultiframeAlarmTrap
ds1RemoteMultiframeAlarmTrap.description: This trap indicates that the far end (remote) unit, connected to the user E1 interface, reports Loss of Multiframe Alignment.

ds1LinkFrameSlipTrap.name: ds1LinkFrameSlipTrap
ds1LinkFrameSlipTrap.description: This trap indicates that a Frame Slip occurred at the user DS1 interface. This usually indicates timing problems (incorrect selection of timing reference), on the user DS1 link.

ds1BpvErrorTrap.name: ds1BpvErrorTrap
ds1BpvErrorTrap.description: This trap indicates a Bipolar Violation (BPV) error has been detected at the user DS1 interface.

ds1ExcessiveBpvTrap.name: ds1ExcessiveBpvTrap
ds1ExcessiveBpvTrap.description: This trap indicates excessive number of Bipolar Violation errors (BPV) detected by the user DS1 interface

ds1Crc4ErrorTrap.name: ds1Crc4ErrorTrap
ds1Crc4ErrorTrap.description: This trap indicates that a frame with CRC-4 error has been detected at the user DS1 interface.

ds1ExcessiveErrorRatioTrap.name: ds1ExcessiveErrorRatioTrap
ds1ExcessiveErrorRatioTrap.description: This trap indicates that the error rate, detected at the user DS1 interface, on the frame synchronization bits is high, as defined by ITU-T Rec. G.732.

ds1RemoteSyncLossTrap.name: ds1RemoteSyncLossTrap
ds1RemoteSyncLossTrap.description: This trap indicates that the far-end (remote) unit, connected to user DS1 interface, reports Loss of Frame Alignment (Sync Loss).

ds1LocalSyncLossTrap.name: ds1LocalSyncLossTrap
ds1LocalSyncLossTrap.description: This trap indicates near end (Local) Loss of Frame Alignment failure (Sync Loss), of the user DS1 interface

ds1AisSyncLossTrap.name: ds1AisSyncLossTrap
ds1AisSyncLossTrap.description: This trap indicates near end (Local) Loss of Frame Alignment (Sync Loss), caused by the reception of AIS at the user DS1 interface.

ds1AisTrap.name: ds1AisTrap
ds1AisTrap.description: This trap indicates AIS being received at the user DS1 interface.

ds1NetworkRemoteLoopTrap.name: ds1NetworkRemoteLoopTrap
ds1NetworkRemoteLoopTrap.description: This trap indicates that a remote loopback has been activated, on the local uplink interface.

ds1RemoteLoopTrap.name: ds1RemoteLoopTrap
ds1RemoteLoopTrap.description: This trap indicates that a remote loopback has been activated, on the local user port.

ds1LocalLoopTrap.name: ds1LocalLoopTrap
ds1LocalLoopTrap.description: This trap indicates that a local loopback has been activated on the user port.

ds1ExcessiveFrameSlipTrap.name: ds1ExcessiveFrameSlipTrap
ds1ExcessiveFrameSlipTrap.description: This trap indicates that the number of Frame Slips detected at the user DS1 interface, during the last minute exceeds threshold. For LA-110, threshold value is 10. This usually indicates timing problems (incorrect selection of timing reference) on the user DS1.

ds1ExcessiveCrc4ErrorTrap.name: ds1ExcessiveCrc4ErrorTrap
ds1ExcessiveCrc4ErrorTrap.description: This trap indicates that the error rate detected on the CRC-4 bits at the user DS1 interface, is high.

ds1ExcessiveLocalMfAlarmTrap.name: ds1ExcessiveLocalMfAlarmTrap
ds1ExcessiveLocalMfAlarmTrap.description: This trap indicates that the number of local Loss of Multiframe Alignment events, detected at the user E1 interface during the last minute exceeds threshold. For LA-110, threshold value is 10.

ds1ExcessiveRemoteMfAlarmTrap.name: ds1ExcessiveRemoteMfAlarmTrap
ds1ExcessiveRemoteMfAlarmTrap.description: This trap indicates that the number of Loss of multiframe alignment events reported by the remote unit connected to the user E1 interface during the last minute exceeds threshold. For LA-110, threshold value is 10.

ds1ExcessiveRemoteSyncLossTrap.name: ds1ExcessiveRemoteSyncLossTrap
ds1ExcessiveRemoteSyncLossTrap.description: This trap indicates that the number of far end (remote) Loss of Synchronization alarms, reported by the user DS1 interface during the last minute, exceeds threshold. For LA-110, threshold value is 10.

ds1ExcessiveLocalSyncLossTrap.name: ds1ExcessiveLocalSyncLossTrap
ds1ExcessiveLocalSyncLossTrap.description: This trap indicates that the number of Loss of local Synchronization alarms reported by the user DS1 interface during the last minute, exceeds threshold. For LA-110, threshold value is 10.
